intro: Achillea bulgarica, commonly known as Bulgarian yarrow, is a perennial herb native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads that range from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, gray-green leaves. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
